p: Limonoids are a prominent group of oxygenated triterpenoids, present in the pulp, seed, and peel tissues of oranges [ 100]. Both lactones and glucosides are soluble in water but do not contribute much to citrus fruit taste. In contrast, limonoid aglycones, such as limonin ( Figure 15a) and nomilin ( Figure 15b), impart the sour taste of bitter orange [ 49].
